snippet: Texas has turned to a compounding pharmacy to replace its expired execution drugs, according to documents released Wednesday.
abstract: Documents show that Texas, nation's most active death-penalty state, has turned to a compounding pharmacy to replace its expired execution drugs, weeks after prison officials declined to say how they obtained the drugs amid a nationwide shortage.
lead_paragraph: Texas has turned to a compounding pharmacy to replace its expired execution drugs, according to documents released Wednesday.

headline.main: Texas: State Bought Execution Drugs From a Compounding Pharmacy
headline.print_headline: Texas: State Bought Execution Drugs From a Compounding Pharmacy
